children.value: Used to toggle between on and off state.
Bind the selected state of the switch through

props.code:
import { ref } from 'vue';
const checked = ref(true);

children.value: attribute. When disabled, the switch cannot be clicked.
Set the switch to the loading state through the
attribute. The switch is not clickable in the loading state.
Customize the size of the switch via the
attribute represents the background color when it is opened, and
represents the background color when it is closed.
Customize the content of the button via the

props.code:
<z-switch v-model="checked">
<template #node>
<view class="icon-wrapper">
<z-icon
:name="checked ? 'plus-circle-fill' : 'minus-circle-fill'"
:color="checked ? 'var(--z-blue)' : 'var(--z-gray-5)'"
size="40rpx"
/>
</view>
</template>
</z-switch>

<style>
.demo-switch {
.icon-wrapper {
display: flex;
align-items: center;
justify-content: center;
width: 100%;
height: 100%;
}
}
</style>

children.value: When you need to control the switch asynchronously, you can use the
, and manually handle the switch status in the event callback function.

props.code:
<script lang="ts" setup>
import { ref } from 'vue'
import { useDialog } from '../../uni_modules/zebra-ui'
const dialog = useDialog()
const checked = ref(true)
const onUpdateValue = (newValue: any) => {
dialog
.showConfirmDialog({
title: 'Reminder',
message: 'Do you want to toggle the switch? '
})
.then(() => {
checked.value = newValue
})
}
</script>

children.value: 'Do you want to toggle the switch? '
